result.execSummary:
The defendant Donece T Raybon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is ordered to be paid joint & several with the co-defendant, Davari Weaver.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. 

Restitution, fines and costs shall be paid with the current payment plan for attorney fees at the rate of $25/month on the 15th of each month until paid in full or civil judgment shall enter.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. 

Restitution, fines and costs shall be paid with the current payment plan for attorney fees at the rate of $25/month on the 15th of each month until paid in full or civil judgment shall enter.

Defendant shall reimburse the Clerk of Courts for attorney fees as previously ordered or judgment shall be entered. 

Restitution, fines and costs shall be paid with the current payment plan for attorney fees at the rate of $25/month on the 15th of each month until paid in full or civil judgment shall enter.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order to Reimburse Washington County for Attorney Fees
for Payment of Fees for Attorney Michelle Wenninger $335.00

Defendant Donece T Raybon in court.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Donece T Raybon.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Agreement reached - portion of up-front restitution has been paid.  State moves to amend charge to Misd Retail Theft, 943.50(1m)(b)&(4)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters no contest plea.  Court finds def guilty.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Defendant Donece T Raybon in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def doesn't qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Wenninger.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $25 per month commencing 9-15-22. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:45 am.
No contact with Wash. Co. Walmart Stores

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donece T Raybon in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
